p:
Yellow fever virus, the etiological agent of YF, belongs to the Flaviviridae family, genus Flavivirus, which are enveloped positive-sense single-stranded RNA viruses
6 - 8 . The production of a single polyprotein of the YFV occurs after the virus infects a host cell, thus beginning the translation of the viral genome. The thi protein is cleaved by the YFV proteases of the host, producing viral proteins that are essential for the virus genome replication and virion production
7 , 9 . A meticulous study of the yellow fever virus genome is essential to establish genetic differences between virus strains, helping the development of new treatments
7 , 9 .
